posts.name: Will C
posts.cooked: Teams that run solid core pool noodles on your bumpers, what kind of difference have you seen it make? Is the solid core any more worth it over normal pool noodles?

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: 3176 Risk Mitigation Specialist + 3D Printing Lead + Fabrication and Design

posts.custom_user_title: 3176 Risk Mitigation Specialist + 3D Printing Lead + Fabrication and Design

posts.name: Chris Cross
posts.cooked: In our experience, the solid core noodles seem to hold up better over the long run.  I have no empirical data, only anecdotal.  As far as actual protection of the robot?  Not sure there is much of a difference.  I think the quality of the pool noodle is more of a factor than hollow versus solid.  YMMV.

posts.name: Brian Wagg
posts.cooked: We haven’t run solid core noodles (yet, we’ve still got a few of these to get through… ), but my understanding is that because they are solid, they don’t compress or deform nearly as much as “normal” noodles. The hollow/normal noodles can quickly lead to sagging bumpers after an event with hard hits between robots. I hear that solid core noodles hold up better in this regard.

This year we are swapping to solid noodles. The hollow ones just don’t seem to hold up for a whole season. We ended up slicing up the rest of our hollow noodles to use as a filler for the hollow ones we used last year, we were just using up what we had before swapping. Filling the hollow seemed to help some. I’m not sure if its tge quality of noodles lately or the fact that the robots have gotten so much faster and that is leading to them not lasting a whole season. Im leaning towards the faster and harder defense because even our fabric from this past years robot is in far worse shape than in previous years
